messages.title: The best choice for Cambridge
messages.content: As our MP, Julian had a strong record of delivering real improvements for Cambridge.

messages.title: Back Julian for an MP who will:
messages.content: Oppose Brexit and protect EU citizens. Invest properly in our NHS. Protect funding for local schools.

messages.title: SEND THERESA MAY A STRONG ANTI-BREXIT MESSAGE

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Julian's position is that Britain’s access to the single market is vital and the country must remain within the world's largest trade market.
Julian and his party aims to properly support nurses, doctors, and patients. They will invest an extra £6 billion a year, funded by a proposed 1p rise in the income tax rate.
Julian's Lib Dems will reverse cuts, providing £7 billion more to schools and colleges, with funding allocated to smaller class sizes, more resources, and teaching assistants or reduced lessons.

issues.brexitEurope: Julian's position is that Britain must remain within the European market.
issues.education: Julian's Lib Dems will reverse cuts, providing £7 billion more to schools and colleges.
issues.health: Julian and his party will invest an extra £6 billion a year in the NHS.

politicalExperience.achievements: On health: Julian gained an extra £20 million for local NHS services and secured the funding to get Papworth Hospital moved to the city’s Addenbrooke’s site. On schools: Julian worked hard to deliver an additional £23.2 million each year to help Cambridgeshire children. On transport: Julian successfully fought for the new Cambridge North station and Chisholm Trail cycle and pedestrian route.

quotes.text: Corbyn’s weak opposition allowed Theresa May to sail ahead on Brexit.
Jeremy Corbyn’s Labour Party has aligned with UKIP to vote for Brexit.
quotes.source: DENIS MACSHANE - FORMER LABOUR EUROPE MINISTER - 12 MAY 2017

leaflet.additionalNotes: Julian, who grew up here in Cambridge, gained widespread praise for his tireless work securing more funding for local schools and health services.
